title: Venancio Ramos
text:
Venancio Ariel Ramos Villanueva (born 20 June 1959) is a retired <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> <a href="Striker%20%28association%20football%29">striker</a> from <a href="Uruguay">Uruguay</a>, who was <a href="nickname">nickname</a>d "Chicharra" during his professional career.
Club career.
Ramos started his playing career in 1977 with <a href="C.A.%20Pe%C3%B1arol">Peñarol</a> with whom he won several major championships including four <a href="Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20Uruguaya">Uruguayan Primera</a> titles, the <a href="Copa%20Libertadores">Copa Libertadores</a> and <a href="Copa%20Intercontinental">Copa Intercontinental</a> in 1982. 
In 1984, he joined <a href="France">French</a> side <a href="RC%20Lens">Lens</a> before returning to South America in 1986 to play for <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Independiente">Independiente</a> of <a href="Argentina">Argentina</a>.
Ramos returned to Uruguay in 1989 where he played for <a href="Racing%20Club%20de%20Montevideo">Racing Montevideo</a> then Peñarol's fiercest rivals <a href="Club%20Nacional%20de%20Football">Nacional</a>. In his later years he played for <a href="Defensor%20Sporting">Defensor Sporting</a> and finally <a href="El%20Tanque%20Sisley">El Tanque Sisley</a>.
International career.
He made his official international debut on May 24, 1978 against Spain (0-0), Ramos obtained a total number of 41 international caps for the <a href="Uruguay%20national%20football%20team">Uruguay national football team</a>. He represented his native country at the <a href="1986%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1986 FIFA World Cup</a>, wearing the number nineteen jersey.
